attributes.action: stop rejecting petitions on the grounds that "it was outside the remit or powers of the Prime Minister and Government" when they very obviously are not.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many other petitions are rejected on the grounds that the things they are requesting are "outside the remit or powers of the Prime Minister and Government". But this is often completely untrue - the Prime Minister can sing "We're going to hang out the washing on the Siegfried line" while standing in a barrel of custard if he wants to and to suggest otherwise is entirely wrong. I don't see why he couldn't pass a law to stop the Yanks calling us Brits. I thought Blair was mates with Blur. 

Frankly, with their powers, the government should be able to do anything. Stopping Simon Edwards with the new anti-terrorist powers should be a piece of cake and to not have done so is to endanger the public.

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
